oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Die Sonnenblume – eine Eiweißpflanze für den Ökologischen Landbau?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hahn, Volker
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Even though sunflower is primarily considered an oilseed crop, sunflower meal or cake is interesting for animal food, especially for organic farming, where the supply of protein is complicated. The quality of the oil cake is determined by its protein content. A breeding goal for the use of sunflower meal as a protein source is thus to increase the protein content of sunflower seeds without decreasing the oil content.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hahn, Volker (2007) Die Sonnenblume – eine Eiweißpflanze für den Ökologischen Landbau? [Sunflower – a Protein Source for Organic Farming?] Poster at: Zwischen Tradition und Globalisierung - 9. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Universität Hohenheim, Stuttgart, Deutschland, 20.-23.03.2007.
